issue.title: Misleading "Just launched" label
issue.body: When an experiment is new, it shows a `Just Launched` label on the experiment card that goes away when you visit it: This is unexpected. Visiting a page does not change that an experimented had recently been launched.

comment.body:
> Hi @wresuolc , I am a student at seneca college. I'm currently taking a open source course, looking for my first bug. If this bug is not assigned to someone, can I work on it for my assignment?
Thank you!

Thank *you*, we'd very much appreciate the contribution! Feel free to ask for help or raise any questions you might think of!

issue.title: Break down ExperimentDetails container into (mostly) simple components
issue.body:
Opening a WIP PR for this, now that I'm a bit into it. It's getting to be a large set of changes, but mostly just shuffling things around. Trying to break things up into multiple commits to capture smaller discrete changes.

Overview of things I've done so far:

* Move components from `components/` folder into `containers/ExperimentPage/` where they are only ever used by the experiment page. Import paths adjusted as necessary.
* Merged ExperimentPage tests into `containers/ExperimentPage/tests.js`. Import paths adjusted as necessary.
* Lint fixes to test code, because it seems that eslint wasn't checking those and a pile of little problems snuck in.
* Trying to apply more flow type annotations, which seems to work better with separate `types.js` modules. Importing both a component class and a type from the same module seems to be a linting error.

Things left to do:
- [ ] Fill out more stories around sub-components
- [ ] Further break up the mass of markup in ExperimentPage down into sub-components

comment.body: Alright: After some IRC chat, I'm going to take the WIP off this PR and stop adding to it. There's enough here to have a good start on pulling further things out in smaller chunks.

issue.title: [WIP] Break down ExperimentDetails container into (mostly) simple components
issue.body:
Opening a WIP PR for this, now that I'm a bit into it. It's getting to be a large set of changes, but mostly just shuffling things around. Trying to break things up into multiple commits to capture smaller discrete changes.

Overview of things I've done so far:

* Move components from `components/` folder into `containers/ExperimentPage/` where they are only ever used by the experiment page. Import paths adjusted as necessary.
* Merged ExperimentPage tests into `containers/ExperimentPage/tests.js`. Import paths adjusted as necessary.
* Lint fixes to test code, because it seems that eslint wasn't checking those and a pile of little problems snuck in.
* Trying to apply more flow type annotations, which seems to work better with separate `types.js` modules. Importing both a component class and a type from the same module seems to be a linting error.

Things left to do:
- [ ] Fill out more stories around sub-components
- [ ] Further break up the mass of markup in ExperimentPage down into sub-components

comment.body:
I'm also kind of on the fence about this bit from [the reorg proposal](https://gist.github.com/chuckharmston/01e5b7a16ba9b771863cbb8b2de64138), now that I'm in the thick of things:
> Dependent components will be defined in the same file as the parent component. 
I can merge them together before we merge this PR. But, so far, it's feeling a little more manageable to leave dependent components for ExperimentPage in separate files because there are just so many of them.

issue.title: Test Pilot wrongly removes also the enabled experiments at uninstall
issue.body:
**[Affected versions]:**
- Firefox 55.0.3 and above

**[Affected Platforms]:**
- All Windows

**[Prerequisites]:**
- The "testpilot.env" string pref was manually added with "stage" value on a new clean profile in "about:config" page.
- The "extensions.webapi.testing" boolean pref was manually added with "true" value on the crated profile.
- Test Pilot stage add-on was already installed on the created profile.

**[Steps to reproduce]:**
1. Open Firefox browser with the profile from prerequisites and navigate to https://testpilot.dev.mozaws.net page.
2. Choose to install Test Pilot add-on.
3. Click on any of the active experiments cards and enable at least one of them
4. Restart the browser.
5. Navigate again to https://testpilot.dev.mozaws.net page and click on "Settings" top right button.
6. While observing the enabled experiment(s) card(s) ,choose to uninstall Test Pilot and confirm the action. 

**[Expected result]:**
- Test Pilot add-on is removed, you are redirected to Homepage but the enabled experiment remains enabled.

**[Actual result]:**
- Test Pilot add-on is removed but you wrongly remain on the experiments page and the enabled experiment is also removed.

**[Notes]:**
- The same behavior occurs even if you manually remove Test Pilot add-on from about:addons page.

comment.body:
>  but I'll keep an eye for any strange behavior in the future

Thanks for keeping an eye on this stuff! It's annoying that it seems like it has a mind of its own sometimes 😟
